query: How effective would the power to turn any liquid into chocolate milk be for grocery shopping?
response: Extremely effective - you'd save money on beverages and become the most popular person at every potluck. Plus, emergency hydration has never been more delicious.

query: Rate the usefulness of being able to communicate telepathically with houseplants for apartment living.
response: Moderately useful - you'd finally know when to water them, but also have to deal with their constant complaints about your music choices and their existential plant drama.

query: How practical would super speed (but only while doing laundry) be for daily life?
response: Surprisingly practical - laundry would be done in seconds, though you'd need to explain to neighbors why sonic booms happen every Sunday morning.

query: Evaluate the effectiveness of having the ability to make any electronic device play only elevator music.
response: Devastatingly effective for revenge but terrible for personal use. You'd become a supervillain by accident within a week.

query: How useful would X-ray vision that only works on food containers be for meal planning?
response: Incredibly useful - no more surprise moldy leftovers or mystery takeout containers. You'd become the household food safety hero.

query: Rate the practicality of being able to summon exactly one rubber duck at will.
response: Surprisingly practical - debugging code would be easier, bath time is always ready, and you'd have unlimited squeaky stress relief.

query: How effective would the power to make any line you're standing in move 50% faster be?
response: Life-changingly effective - grocery stores, DMV, coffee shops. You'd become a local legend and probably start charging for your services.

query: Evaluate the usefulness of being able to understand what dogs are thinking, but only about their favorite toys.
response: Moderately useful for dog owners - you'd know which toys to buy, but also discover most dogs have surprisingly complex theories about squeaky toys and existential toy anxiety.

query: How practical would the ability to make any food taste like pizza be for dieting?
response: Paradoxically impractical - healthy eating becomes easier, but everything tastes like pizza so you're never actually satisfied. Also, pizza loses its special meaning.

query: Rate the effectiveness of being able to instantly fold fitted sheets perfectly.
response: Moderately effective in personal life but world-changing if monetized. You could start a fitted sheet folding service and become the Martha Stewart of linens.

query: How useful would the power to make traffic lights turn green by snapping your fingers be for commuting?
response: Extremely useful but ethically questionable - great for your commute, chaos for traffic patterns. You'd probably cause accidents while trying to help.

query: Evaluate the practicality of being able to charge electronic devices by touching them, but it drains your own energy proportionally.
response: Impractical for daily use - charging a phone would leave you needing a nap, charging a laptop would require a full meal and recovery time.
